text: Rize Province (Armenian: Ռիզե, romanized: Rrize; Laz: რიზინი, romanized: Rizini; Georgian: რიზე, romanized: Rize) is a province of northeast Turkey, on the eastern Black Sea coast between Trabzon and Artvin. {{Infobox settlement | name = Rize Province | population_density_km2 = auto | leader_title1 = | leader_name1 = | total_type = Total | area_total_km2 = 3,920 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 344359 | population_as_of = 2020 | population_urban = | leader_title = Electoral district | population_urban_footnotes = | population_rural = | population_rural_footnotes = | area_code_type = | area_code = | registration_plate = | website = | footnotes = | leader_name = | coordinates = | native_name = Rrize Ռիզե Rizini რიზინი Rize რიზე | map_caption = Location of Rize Province in Turkey | native_name_lang = tr | settlement_type = Province | image_skyline = | image_caption = A view from Rize | image_flag = | image_seal = | image_map = Rize in Turkey.svg | mapsize = 300px | subdivision_type = Country | seat1 = | subdivision_name = Turkey | subdivision_type1 = Region | subdivision_name1 = East Black Sea | subdivision_type2 = | subdivision_name2 = | seat_type = Provincial seat and largest city | seat = | seat1_type = Largest city | official_name = }} Armenian (Hemshin),Simonian, Hovann (2007). The Hemshin: History, Society and Identity in the Highlands of Northeast Turkey. Routledge. p. 320, "The Hemshin People live in [...] from the county of Çayeli, in the province of Rize, as far east as the Georgian border of the county of Hopa, in the province of Artvin." Georgian, Laz and Turkish people live in Rize. == References == == Notes == Category:Provinces of Turkey Category:Black Sea Region
title: Rize Province
